items.headline: Blazers All-Star G Avdija Exits Game with Recurring Back Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers All-Star guard Deni Avdija left Sunday's game against the Phoenix Suns in the first minute due to a recurring lower back injury and did not return. Avdija, who was questionable entering the game and has been battling back issues for weeks, averages 25.0 points, 7.2 rebounds, and 6.8 assists this season. His status for upcoming games is now uncertain.

items.headline: Suns Rocked by Multiple Injuries: Brooks Fractures Hand, Booker Out with Hip Strain
items.summary: The Phoenix Suns are facing significant injury setbacks with Dillon Brooks fracturing his left hand during Saturday's double-overtime win against Orlando. Brooks is having a career-best season, averaging 20.9 points. Additionally, star guard Devin Booker is sidelined for at least a week with a strained right hip. Grayson Allen (ankle/knee) and Jordan Goodwin (calf) were also out Sunday.

items.headline: Celtics Sweep Season Series Against Lakers
Raptors Dominate Bucks on the Road
Hawks Soar Past Nets at Home
Mavericks Outlast Pacers in High-Scoring Affair
Spurs Extend Win Streak Over Kings
Suns Win Double-OT Thriller Against Magic
Towns Leads Knicks with Another Double-Double
items.summary: Karl-Anthony Towns (NYK) recorded his NBA-leading 39th double-double with 28 points and 11 rebounds in the Knicks' win over the Bulls.

items.headline: Celtics Duo Shines Against Lakers
items.summary: Jaylen Brown (BOS) posted 32 points, 8 rebounds, and 7 assists, while Payton Pritchard (BOS) added 30 points with 6 three-pointers and 8 assists in Boston's victory over the Lakers.

items.headline: Maxey Explodes for 39 Points
items.summary: Tyrese Maxey (PHI) led all scorers with an impressive 39 points in the 76ers' dominant win against the Timberwolves.

items.headline: Wembanyama Continues Stellar Rookie Season
items.summary: Victor Wembanyama (SAS) delivered another strong performance with 28 points and 15 rebounds, contributing to the Spurs' extended winning streak.

items.headline: LeBron James Reaches 43,000 Career Points
items.summary: LeBron James (LAL) continued to re-write history, surpassing 43,000 career points while scoring 20 points against the Celtics.

items.headline: Bane Leads Magic with 34 Points
items.summary: Despite the double-overtime loss, Desmond Bane (ORL) poured in 34 points for the Orlando Magic against the Phoenix Suns.

items.headline: Dyson Daniels' Versatile Night
items.summary: Australian guard Dyson Daniels (ATL) contributed across the board with 7 points, 10 rebounds, 8 assists, and 3 steals in the Hawks' win over the Nets.

items.headline: Eastern Conference Playoff Picture Heating Up
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 42-13 record, followed by the Boston Celtics (36-19) and New York Knicks (36-21).

items.headline: Western Conference Race Tight at the Top
items.summary: In the Western Conference, the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot at 43-14, with the San Antonio Spurs (40-16) and Denver Nuggets (36-21) close behind.

items.headline: Australian Rookie Rocco Zikarsky Makes NBA Debut for Timberwolves
items.summary: Nineteen-year-old Australian center Rocco Zikarsky (MIN) played his first NBA minutes in the Minnesota Timberwolves' game against the Philadelphia 76ers. Recalled from the G League due to injuries to Rudy Gobert and Naz Reid, Zikarsky pulled down one rebound in four minutes of play.

items.headline: Injury Report: Bulls, Lakers, Rockets, Jazz Face Absences
items.summary: The Chicago Bulls are without Jaden Ivey (knee) and Anfernee Simons (wrist). The Lakers' Jaxson Hayes exited Sunday's game with an ankle injury. Houston is missing Fred VanVleet (ACL, out for season), Steven Adams (ankle, out for season), and Jae'Sean Tate (knee). Utah's Jaren Jackson Jr. (knee) and Walker Kessler (shoulder) are out for the season, while Jusuf Nurkic (nose) is out and Keyonte George (ankle) is questionable.
